1:
God, you are my God! I earnestly search for you,\q my soul thirsts for you, and my flesh longs for you,
\q in a dry and weary land where there is no water.
\q
2:
So I have looked on you in the sanctuary,\q to see your power and your glory.


\q
3:
Because your covenant faithfulness is better than life,\q my lips will praise you.
\q
4:
So I will bless you while I live;\q I will lift up my hands in your name.


\q
5:
It will be as if I ate a meal of marrow and fatness;\q with joyful lips my mouth will praise you,
\q
6:
when I think about you on my bed\q and meditate on you in the night hours.


\q
7:
For you have been my help,\q and in the shadow of your wings I rejoice.
\q
8:
I cling to you;\q your right hand supports me.


\q
9: But those who seek to destroy my life\q will go down into the lowest parts of the earth;
10:
they will be given over to those whose hands use the sword,\q and they will become food for the jackals.


\q
11:
But the king will rejoice in God;\q everyone who swears by him will be proud of him,
\q but the mouth of those who speak lies will be stopped up.
